remarks: A mapping ` X --> Y ` , where ` X ` is first-countable, is continuous iff it is sequentially continuous, meaning that for any sequence ` f ( n ) ` converging to ` x ` , its image under ` F ` converges to ` F ( x ) ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2015.)
